text: testified as follows:
- - - EXAMINATION

Good morning, ma'am.  My name is Marc Weinberg.  I'm an attorney that's been retained to represent Ms. Shchogol regarding an accident that happened back on October 31, 2017.  I'm here to actually take your deposition with regard to the facts and circumstances surrounding that accident.  Do you understand that?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  To your left is a court reporter.  She will be taking down everything that is said here today.  All the information will be transcribed, placed into a booklet, and made available to myself and your counsel prior to the hearing.  Do you understand that?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All of your responses have to be verbal.  Head nods, body movements, things of that nature cannot be taken down on the record. Do you understand that?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: If you don't understand a question, tell me you don't understand it.  I will be more than happy to rephrase the question.  Okay?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Question that may come up that involve time, distance, things like that.  If I ask you those questions, I'm going to go and assume when you're answering those questions that you're estimating or approximating in certain response.  If you're going to do that, please tell me you're estimating or approximating in terms of time and distance and things like that.  Okay?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: All right.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  If at some point in time you hear your attorney use the term objection, do not respond to a question and he will tell you whether you can or cannot answer a question.  Do you understand that?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Is there anything that would limit or inhibit your ability to testify here today?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  Did you review any documents in anticipation of this deposition?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you seen a police report?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you seen any photos?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Can you clarify.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Sure.  Photos of any vehicles?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: I took photos the day of.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you seen them today or the last couple weeks or so?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When and where did you see the photos?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Today.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have a copy of those photos with you now?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.  Well, on my e-mail.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can we have those photos pulled up, ma'am?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: While you're pulling those photos up, why did you take the photos?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: To document what happened.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: In case, you know, something like this were to happen.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Let me see if we can break that down.  You took photos at the scene of the accident?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you took the photos in case something like this happened.  Can you be more specific for me.
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Just to have documentation of the accident period.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  When you say if something like this happens, do you mean a lawsuit?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what did you expect the photos to show?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Just what happened to the vehicles.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Why don't you actually pull them up and make sure you show everything to counsel first.  Okay?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Counsel, have the been turned over yet?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: They have.
speaker: MR. SCHLAGNHAUFER

text: (Whereupon, defense counsel shows plaintiff counsel photographs.)
Ma'am, couple of questions. Your counsel was kind enough to let me have some access to his computer.  I'm looking at photographs of a Toyota Highlander XLE.  Was that my client's vehicle?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: I don't know the make and model off the top of my head, but it was a Toyota van.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you were driving a Honda CRV?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: HRV.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did your vehicle sustain damage in the accident?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was your vehicle repaired?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where was it repaired?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Gustafson Auto Body in Willow Grove.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long did it actually take to go and repair the vehicle?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know how long you were without a vehicle for?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.  I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember what the approximate cost was of the repair of your vehicle?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: This is an approximate, I believe it was around $800.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: But that's an approximate.  I don't remember exactly.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: With regard to my client, did you speak to her after the accident?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have any conversation at all?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you exit the vehicle after the accident?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Oh.  Do you mean -- sorry.  Can we go back a second.  I thought you meant, like, a couple days after or something.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: No.  After the accident occurred -- and there was an accident on October 31st of '17, correct?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: After the accident, did you speak to my client?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where did the conversation take place?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: There is a storage unit right off the side of Byberry Road.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you in the street when you had the conversation?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.  We were pulled into the lot.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What consisted -- what was the conversation?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: I asked her if she was okay. She said yes.  That was really it.  We took each other's information.  I asked her if she was hurt.  She said no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You asked her first if she was okay?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And she said yes?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then you asked her after that, are you hurt?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What did she say?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did the police come?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you tell me, regarding the accident itself, did you have any prior damage to your car before the accident?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So the damage that we see in the photographs was caused by the impact?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you see any damage to my client's car?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You don't remember whether there was or there wasn't?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: You mean before the accident happened?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: After the accident, did you see any damage to the rear-end of my client's car?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you look at the back end of her car?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.  When I took the pictures.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you get on the ground and take pictures?  How did you take the pictures?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: I just kneeled and took the pictures.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you touch the back of the car at all, the back bumper at all?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you get underneath the bumper and take it from any angle other than the straight back end of the car?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: I just went around it.  I didn't go underneath the car or anything like that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Gotcha.  Okay.  In your own words, how did the accident happen?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: I was pulling off of Woodhaven Road on Byberry going straight.  I came to a complete stop at the intersection where her car was in front of me.  Then I dosed off and my foot came off the brake and slipped off.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you say you dosed off, what do you mean you dosed off?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: I just got done working three 12 hour night shifts.  My foot was on the brake. I was at a complete stop and my foot slip.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where are you a nurse?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: CHOP.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And what unit are you in?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: At the time it was in the ICU, but now I'm in outpatient neurology.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Outpatient neurology?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Can you tell me, what time did the accident happen?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Approximately, I don't really remember, but approximately 8:30, maybe.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Gotcha.  Was my client's vehicle moving or stopped when the impact occurred?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Stopped.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long was she stopped for?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Do you know how long my client's vehicle was directly in front of you for?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Can you tell me the maximum speed you achieved on Byberry Road before the accident?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Less than ten miles an hour.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How would you describe the traffic, light, medium, or heavy?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Heavy.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  When the accident took place, what caused your vehicle to eventually come to a stop?  Do you know what I mean by that question?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: At some point in time your vehicle came to a stop after the accident; is that correct?  After the accident happened, you were eventually able to stop your vehicle, right?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Well, I was stopped before it and then during the accident I stopped because I hit her.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Right.  That's what I'm saying. At the time of the accident, your vehicle was moving forward, fair?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Right.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How fast were you going when the accident happened?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Less than five miles an hour.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Eventually after the accident, your vehicle stopped completely, right?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Right.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was that because you put your foot on the brake?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.  My foot was on the brake and it slipped off.  When I stopped, I stopped because I hit her.  Is that answering your question?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So what you're saying -- I think you did.  What you're telling us is, I want to be clear for the record, the reason your vehicle came to a stop was the impact with my client's vehicle stopped your car.  Is that fair to say?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Well, I stopped beforehand.  It depends how you're looking at it.  I stopped beforehand because my foot was on the brake and then it slipped off.  Then I stopped again when I hit her.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Right.  Did you reapply your foot to the brake harder or was it the impact with the back end of my client's car that caused your vehicle to stop?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: It was the impact.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The impact.  Did you see what happened to my client inside the car?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.  During it, you mean?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Sure.
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember seeing anything inside the car before the impact?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How about after the impact, was she seated in the driver's seat?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Well, when we pulled over she got out of the car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Gotcha.  Police did not arrive so there is no police report.
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.  We didn't call.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever give any recorded statements to your insurance company?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Recorded statement over-the-phone or a written statement, anything like that?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Sorry.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Prior to the accident, did your vehicle have any mechanical problems of any kind?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Did it have a valid inspection sticker on it?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Roadways were dry?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Roadway was good?  Wasn't a lot of potholes and things like that?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How long did you dose off for?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Less than three seconds.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And was that the first time on that trip that you had dosed off?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  How many times along that way had you dosed off before the accident?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Oh.  On that trip, like, that specific trip?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes.
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: That was the first time.  I thought you meant...
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you done that before in the past?  Has it happened before because you're working 12 hour shifts?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: Yeah.  It's happened in my lifetime.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I got it.  Okay.  Did my client contribute in any way to the accident occurring?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Were her brake lights on when the impact occurred?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Do you remember anything mechanically wrong with my client's car before the impact that you know of?
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: That's all I have.  That's it.
speaker: MR. WEINBERG

text: I don't have any questions for you.
speaker: MR. SCHLAGNHAUFER

text: (Witness excused.)

(Deposition ended at 10:38 a.m.) C E R T I F I C A T E I do hereby certify that I am a Notary Public in good standing, that the aforesaid testimony was taken before me, pursuant to notice, at the time and place indicated; that said deponent was by me duly sworn to tell the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth; that the testimony of said deponent was correctly recorded in machine shorthand by me, to the best of my ability, and thereafter transcribed under my supervision with computer-aided transcription; that the deposition is a true and correct record of the testimony given by the witness; and that I am neither of counsel nor kin to any party in said action, nor interested in the outcome thereof. WITNESS my hand and official seal this 29th day of August, 2019. <%signature%>
